plac.name: plac
plac.description: The smartest command line arguments parser in the world

repo.name: plac
repo.description: Plac: Parsing the Command Line the Easy Way

readme.summary: Excellent clarity and quick start with comprehensive examples, but lacks troubleshooting guidance and deeper configuration documentation.
readme.top_issue: No troubleshooting section - common errors, edge cases, or debugging tips are not documented

common_complaints: Incomplete feature support (keyword-only arguments, *args combinations)
Documentation is outdated and difficult to navigate
Compatibility issues with newer Python versions (3.10+, 3.13)
Missing or broken functionality (Interpreter export, runp tests)
CLI design inflexibility (version flag customization)
praise_themes: Library is useful and actively used by developers
Good core concept for simplifying CLI argument handling
sentiment.summary: The plac project shows signs of maintenance neglect with slow responsiveness to bugs, unresolved feature requests from 2020+, and compatibility issues accumulating across Python versions, though the core library remains valued by users.

concerns: No commits for over 8 months (last commit April 2025, current date January 2026)
Zero activity in all measured categories past 6 months
No releases, no merged PRs, no closed issues, no active contributors
Presence of 3 open issues with no resolution activity
No response to pull requests or community engagement
maintenance.summary: The plac package shows clear signs of abandonment with zero development activity over the past 6+ months despite having unresolved issues.

project_metrics.description: Plac: Parsing the Command Line the Easy Way
